name: Ithaca
title: Greek - Ithaca
role: Homeland of Odysseus, Goal of the Odyssey
summary: Ithaca, rocky sea-girt island in the Ionian Sea, is the homeland of Odysseus and the ultimate goal of his ten-year journey in Homer's Odyssey. The entire second half of the epic takes place on and around Ithaca, as Odysseus returns in disguise, discovers his palace overrun by suitors seeking Penelope's hand, and reclaims his kingdom. The island represents home (nostos), fidelity, and the triumph of the returning hero.
description: Rocky Ithaca, the sea-girt island kingdom of Odysseus, is the goal of his twenty-year absence and ten-year journey home in Homer's Odyssey. There faithful Penelope waits, weaving her endless shroud, while 108 suitors consume the palace's goods. Odysseus's return and triumph there conclude the greatest homecoming story ever told.

homeric_context.role_in_epic: Goal of Odysseus's journey; setting for the second half of the epic (Books 13-24)
homeric_context.odysseus_description: Odysseus famously describes Ithaca: 'A rugged land, but a nurse of fine young men'
key_locations: The Palace of Odysseus - where suitors feast and await Penelope's choice
The Cave of the Nymphs - where Odysseus hides Phaeacian gifts
Eumaeus's hut - where Odysseus first shelters in disguise
The orchard of Laertes - where Odysseus reveals himself to his father
The marriage bed rooted in olive tree - the secret that proves Odysseus's identity
famous_scenes: Athena meets Odysseus upon his return (Book 13)
Odysseus at Eumaeus's hut in disguise (Books 14-15)
Recognition by Penelope through the bed secret (Book 23)

the_return.odysseus_absence: Twenty years (ten at Troy, ten returning)
the_return.situation_upon_return: 108 suitors consuming palace goods, seeking Penelope's hand
the_return.penelope_stratagem: Weaving and unraveling shroud for three years
the_return.odysseus_disguise: Returns as beggar, tests loyalty of household
the_return.the_contest: Only Odysseus could string his great bow
the_return.the_slaughter: All 108 suitors killed in the palace
the_return.restoration: Odysseus reclaims throne, reunites with Penelope

primaryLocation.name: Ithaca, Greece (modern island)
primaryLocation.note: The exact identification of Homeric Ithaca remains debated among scholars

thematic_significance.nostos: The Greek concept of homecoming - Ithaca represents the goal of all wandering
thematic_significance.fidelity: Penelope's faithfulness and Odysseus's longing define the island's meaning
thematic_significance.identity: The island is where Odysseus finally reclaims his true identity
thematic_significance.civilization: Restoring order to Ithaca represents the triumph of civilization over chaos
